resources.string: Select which hand to test first
Select which arm to test first
Select which leg to test first
Select which arm to calibrate first
Select which leg to calibrate first

1) Repeatedly tap the red "TAP" button as fast as you can for 10 seconds (the timer starts when you begin tapping)

 2) Repeat the test 3 times in a row for each hand

 3) When the test is completed the app will display your average number of taps for each hand
Average number of taps for each hand

1) Tap the red circle when it appears on screen

 2) The red circle will disappear

 3) After 1-3 seconds a new red circle will be generated at a random location on the screen

 4) Repeat the test 10 times in a row for each hand

 5) When the test is completed the app will display your average response time for each hand
Average normalized response time for each hand (millisec/pixel)

NOTE: First calibrate your device if you have not already done so

 Arm Curl Test:
 1) Hold the device in the palm of your hand with the screen up

 2) Stretch your arm out parallel to your shoulder

 3) When you hear a beep, begin the test by curling your arm to your shoulder and back (if you can't curl up to your shoulder then go as far as you can)

 4) Complete 10 curls in a row for each arm. The app will beep once it has recorded 10 curls

 5) When the test is completed the app will display the total number of complete curls and the average completed curl time for each arm

 Leg Curl Test:
 1) Attach the device to your leg with the screen facing out

 2) Sit on a chair with your legs down

 3) When you hear a beep, begin the test by curling your leg parallel to your knee and back (if you can't curl up to your knee then go as far as you can)

 4) Complete 10 curls in a row for each leg. The app will beep once it has recorded 10 curls

 5) When the test is completed the app will display the total number of complete curls and the average completed curl time for each leg

Arm Calibration:
 1) Hold the device in the palm of your hand with the screen up

 2) Stretch your arm out parallel to your shoulder and hold your arm in the stretched position for 10 seconds

 3) You will hear a beep when the timer starts and ends, this records your arm's stretched out position

 4) Curl your arm to your shoulder and hold your arm in the curled position for 10 seconds

 5) You will hear a beep when the timer starts and ends, this records your arm's curled position

 6) Repeat the calibration for both arms

 Leg Calibration:
 1) Attach the device to your leg with the screen facing outward

 2) Sit on a chair with your legs down and tap the screen to begin calibration and keep your legs at a 90 degree angle to the ground for 10 seconds

 3) You will hear a beep when the timer starts and ends, this records your leg's curled position

 4) Stretch your leg up parallel to your knee and hold your leg in the stretched position for 10 seconds

 5) You will hear a beep when the timer starts and ends, this records your leg's stretched out position

 6) Repeat the calibration for both legs

1) Make sure that you phone's volume is on

 2) Begin the test and walk 25 steps

 3) The phone's pedometer will count the steps and output a small beep to signal that the test is over

 4) When the test is completed the app will display your average speed for walking 25 steps
